ResumeParserData.Qualification:
B.E. ( Civil Engineering ) from Birla Institute of Technology, Mesra, Ranchi, 1988




Mr. Abhijeet Kumar is a Graduate in Civil Engineering with more than 29 years of extensive professional experience in road sector with particular emphasis on Material and Geotechnical investigation and laboratory testing.  
 He followed latest quality management techniques using modern technology and has been responsible for preparation of Quality Assurance Plan considering the latest and modern technology; identification of sources of materials including borrow areas and quarries, review the test results of bore holes, quarry and borrow area material to find out their strength characteristics and suitability for using them in construction, conducting all field and laboratory tests on various materials, analysis of data and interpretation of results for establishing parameters for designing pavements, high embankments, foundations for bridges and other structures; He has been responsible for reviewing Work Program, construction methods and adherence to environmental norms and performance of plant, equipment and machinery; Inspect field laboratories to ensure adequacy of their equipment and capability to perform all the specified testing requirements; Check the setting up of rock crushers and bituminous mixing plants to ensure that the specified requirements for such equipment's are fully met. Review the Quality Assurance Plan and recommend changes considered necessary; Review of test results for manufactured materials required for road and structural works such as bitumen, cement, steel, etc.  
 He has good understanding of formulation and implementation of Quality Assurance Program, Modern Construction Techniques in highway Projects. He is thoroughly conversant with IRC Specifications and Standards, MORT&H Specifications for Road and Bridge Works

WorkHistory.JobDescription:
Project : Independent Engineer Services for 4 laning of Kashipur - Sitarganj Section of NH- 74 from Km 175.000 to Km 252.200 Existing Chainage Km 256.900 in the States of Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh under NHDP Phase IV on PPP Mode Project Length : 77.22 Km Lane-4 Project Cost : INR 757.40 Crore Client : National Highways Authority of India 
 
 Description of Duties : Responsibilities included Use of innovative and nontraditional technology. He was responsible for design and checking preparation of submission of work programme along with allocation of materials, machineries, manpower and cash flow programme Method statements as per approved work programme Preparation of Quality Assurance Program considering the latest and modern technology Finalization of work orders of labour contractors and sub-contractors. Planning and monitoring of day to day activities. Installation of crusher, Hot Mix Pant, WMM Plant and Cement Concrete Batching Plant Procurements of materials i.e. cement, steel, aggregates, diesel to fulfil the requirements of site Maintaining the stock of spare parts for timely maintenance of the machineries and plants Follow the Quality Assurance Program during construction He is familiar with material property of road construction material, technical specifications and procedures of material tests and testing equipments.

ResumeParserData.ExecutiveSummary: TPF has an experience in the domain of Engineering, particularly in Civil Engineer. and is currently working as Senior Quality cum Material Expert at Artefact Projects Ltd since 5.7 Years.
ResumeParserData.ManagementSummary: Currently TPF holds a Mid Management Level position, as "Builder Construction Manager" at M/s Ashiana. from 01/01/1993 to 31/1/1998. The candidate has a total experience of 5.1 years in this company.

Education :

Key Qualifications : 

Mr. Abhijeet Kumar is a Graduate in Civil Engineering with more than 29 years of extensive professional experience in road sector with particular emphasis on Material and Geotechnical investigation and laboratory testing. 
He followed latest quality management techniques using modern technology and has been responsible for preparation of Quality Assurance Plan considering the latest and modern technology; identification of sources of materials including borrow areas and quarries, review the test results of bore holes, quarry and borrow area material to find out their strength characteristics and suitability for using them in construction, conducting all field and laboratory tests on various materials, analysis of data and interpretation of results for establishing parameters for designing pavements, high embankments, foundations for bridges and other structures; He has been responsible for reviewing Work Program, construction methods and adherence to environmental norms and performance of plant, equipment and machinery; Inspect field laboratories to ensure adequacy of their equipment and capability to perform all the specified testing requirements; Check the setting up of rock crushers and bituminous mixing plants to ensure that the specified requirements for such equipment's are fully met. Review the Quality Assurance Plan and recommend changes considered necessary; Review of test results for manufactured materials required for road and structural works such as bitumen, cement, steel, etc. 
He has good understanding of formulation and implementation of Quality Assurance Program, Modern Construction Techniques in highway Projects. He is thoroughly conversant with IRC Specifications and Standards, MORT&H Specifications for Road and Bridge Works

Description of Duties : Responsibilities included Use of innovative and nontraditional technology. Education:

  • B.E. (Civil Engineering) from Birla Institute of Technology, Mesra, Ranchi, 1988

Key Qualifications:

 

Mr. Abhijeet Kumar is a Graduate in Civil Engineering with more than 29 years of extensive professional experience in road sector with particular emphasis on Material and Geotechnical investigation and laboratory testing.

He followed latest quality management techniques using modern technology and has been responsible for preparation of Quality Assurance Plan considering the latest and modern technology; identification of sources of materials including borrow areas and quarries, review the test results of bore holes, quarry and borrow area material to find out their strength characteristics and suitability for using them in construction, conducting all field and laboratory tests on various materials, analysis of data and interpretation of results for establishing parameters for designing pavements, high embankments, foundations for bridges and other structures; He has been responsible for reviewing Work Program, construction methods and adherence to environmental norms and performance of plant, equipment and machinery; Inspect field laboratories to ensure adequacy of their equipment and capability to perform all the specified testing requirements; Check the setting up of rock crushers and bituminous mixing plants to ensure that the specified requirements for such equipment's are fully met. Review the Quality Assurance Plan and recommend changes considered necessary; Review of test results for manufactured materials required for road and structural works such as bitumen, cement, steel, etc.

He has good understanding of formulation and implementation of Quality Assurance Program, Modern Construction Techniques in highway Projects. He is thoroughly conversant with IRC Specifications and Standards, MORT&H Specifications for Road and Bridge Works

Employment Record

:

 

 

Jun 2014 to till date

Artefact Projects Ltd.

Senior Quality cum Material Expert

Project: Independent Engineer Services for 4 laning of Kashipur - Sitarganj Section of NH-74 from Km 175.000 to Km 252.200 (Existing Chainage Km 256.900) in the States of Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh under NHDP Phase IV on PPP Mode; Project Length: 77.22 Km; Lane-4; Project Cost: INR 757.40 Crore; Client: National Highways Authority of India;

 

Description of Duties: Responsibilities included Use of innovative and nontraditional technology. He was responsible for design and checking preparation of submission of work programme along with allocation of materials, machineries, manpower and cash flow programme; Method statements as per approved work programme; Preparation of Quality Assurance Program considering the latest and modern technology; Finalization of work orders of labour contractors and sub-contractors. Planning and monitoring of day to day activities. Installation of crusher, Hot Mix Pant, WMM Plant and Cement Concrete Batching Plant; Procurements of materials i.e. cement, steel, aggregates, diesel to fulfil the requirements of site; Maintaining the stock of spare parts for timely maintenance of the machineries and plants; Follow the Quality Assurance Program during construction He is familiar with material property of road construction material, technical specifications and procedures of material tests and testing equipments.

 

Jun 2013 to May 2014

Consulting Engineers Group India

Sr. Material Engineer

 

Project: Construction Supervision of Two Lanning Agra - Aligrah from Km 00.00 to Km 79.00 with paved shoulder of section of NH-93 in the State of Uttar Pradesh on BOT (Toll) basis and DBFOT Pattern (PPP Project); Project Length: 79 Km; Lane-2; Project Cost: INR 238 Crore; Client: NHAI;

 

Description of Duties: Organize setting up of project material testing laboratory at site; Reconnaissance of quarries and monitoring of equipment plan; Check material adequacy and suitability for GSB, WMM, bituminous courses, PQC, and structural concrete; Supervision of sampling and Quality Tests; Survey of proposed borrow areas for earth fill embankments; Grain size analysis, proctor, CBR and other requisite tests; Establish suitability of soil material; Use of innovative and nontraditional technology.

 

Jan 2009 to May 2013

URS Scott Wilson (I)Pvt. Ltd.

Material Engineer

 

Project: Construction Supervision for rehabilitation and upgradation to 4/6 lane divided carriageway Configuration of Jhanjharpur - Darbhanga Section of NH-57 in the State of Bihar; Project Length: 43 Km; Lane-4; Project Cost: INR 388 Crore; Client: National Highways Authority of India;

 

Description of Duties: Verifying and approval of setting up of field laboratories and ensure that they are adequately equipped and capable of performing all specified testing requirements; Checking the calibration of laboratory testing equipment; Supervise the setting up of the contractors rock crusher and bituminous mixing plants to ensure that the specified requirements are fully met; Review of Quality Assurance Program considering the latest and modern technology; Ensure all materials testing performed to specifications and quality maintained in all construction works.

 

Sep 2007 to Dec 2008

BSC & C&C (JV)

Project Manager (Eqvt to Sr. Material Engineer)

 

Project: Construction for Strengthening and Widening of existing State Highway from Hisusa to Sikandra in the State of Bihar on EPC mode; Project Length: 55 Km; Lane-2; Project Cost: INR 100 Crore; Client: RSVY Govt. of India;

 

Description of Duties: Responsible for Preparation and establishment of Quality Assurance programs for the project being executed by adopting modern construction technology. Ensure adherence to specifications and standards for highway projects relevant to India and also to internationally accept best practice. Setting up, organization and layout of field testing laboratories and ensuring that the laboratories are staffed with qualified personnel and equipped with duly calibrated testing equipment. Monitor mobilization of various testing equipment as per the specified testing requirements of the project. Implemented Quality Control in all construction works.

 

Jul 2006 to Aug 2007

Som Dutt Builders Ltd.

Sr. Material Engineer

 

Project: Construction for Widening to 4-laning and Strengthening of existing 2 lanning from Sikandra - Bhaunti Stretch from Km 0.00 to Km 62.00 of Section NH-2 in the State of Uttar Pradesh (Package-TNHP/IIA); Project Length: 62.00 Km; Lane-4; Project Cost: INR 362.23 Crore; Client: National Highways Authority of India; Funded by World Bank under FIDIC Condition of Contract

 

Description of Duties: Task assigned included preparation and establishment of Quality Assurance programs for the project being executed by adopting modern construction technology. Ensure adherence to specifications and standards for highway projects relevant to India and also to internationally accept best practice. Setting up, organization and layout of field testing laboratories and ensuring that the laboratories are staffed with qualified personnel and equipped with duly calibrated testing equipment. Use of innovative and nontraditional technology.

 

Jan 2003 to Jun 2006

Progressive Construction Ltd.

Sr. Material Engineer

 

Project: Construction for Widening and Strengthening of Km 410.700 to Km 420.300 & Km 470.000 to Km 476.000 of NH-31 in the State of Bihar and West Bengal; Project Length: 15.60 Km; Lane-4; Project Cost: INR 318 Crore; Client: NHAI;

Project: Construction for Widening and Strengthening of Section Araria - Forbesgang from Km 42.500 to Km 79.500 of NH-57 in the State of Bihar (Package CII/BR-II); Project Length: 37 Km; Lane-4; Project Cost: INR 318 Crore; Client: NHAI;

 

Description of Duties: Responsibilities included establishment of field laboratory and ensure that all instruments / equipment are duly calibrated, preparation of mix design of structure concrete, design of bitumen & concrete mix, testing of construction material and preparation of test report, checking material property of road construction material, construction supervision of various pavement layers i.e. subgrade, GSB, WMM, DBM and BC; setting up, monitoring /inspection of laboratories and conducting various quality control test i.e. gradation of soil and aggregates, Liquid Limit test, plastic limit test, Free swell Index, proctor compaction test, CBR test (Soaked and unsoaked), specific gravity test, water absorption test, AIV test, Flakiness and Elongation Index test, Marshal mould test, penetration test, softening point test, compressive strength test etc. as per IS codes and MORTH specification; monitor the operation of Crusher, Paver, Bituminous and Granular Mixing Plants;

 

Feb 2001 to Dec 2002

Meinhardt (Singapore) Pvt. Ltd.

Material Engineer

 

Project: Construction Supervision for Widening and Strengthening from Km 115.00 to Km 158 of NH-2 in the State of Uttar Pradesh; Project Length: 43.000 Km; Lane-4; Project Cost: INR 285 Crore; Client: National Highways Authority of India;

 

Description of Duties: Task assigned included preparation and checking of embankment bed including compaction, level, moisture content etc. Testing of the materials, checking of levels. Preparation of daily executed quantities of every item of works, dealing with the subcontractors and clients.

 

Feb 1998 to Jan 2001

Transtek, Engineers & Services Pvt. Ltd.

Project Engineer (Eqvt. To Material Engineer)

 

Project: Construction of Four Laning and Strengthening of work of NH-2 section of Aurangabad - Dhanbad from Km 180.00 to Km 398.75 in the State of Bihar (Package-V); Project Length: 220 km; Lane-4; Project Cost: INR 890 Crore; Client: National Highways Authority of India; Funded by World Bank under FIDIC Condition of Contract;

 

Project: Detailed Project Report of 4 Laning and Strengthening work of Section Purnea - Dalkhola from Km 419.00 to Km 447 of NH-31 in the State of Bihar on EPC Mode (Package: EW-12/ BR); Project Length: 28 Km; Lane-4; Project Cost: INR 232 Crores; Client: National Highways Authority of India;

 

Description of Duties: Tasks included various surveys and investigations, pavement crust and subgrade investigations, BBD tests. Detailed quantity computation involved (earthwork, subgrade WBM, levelling course, BM, SDBC etc.). Supervised the work of strengthening and widening including embankment, WBM/WMM and was also engaged in supervision of various box and slab culverts falling on the highway; ensured quality control; carried out all tests in filed and laboratory to ensure adherence to specifications.

 

Jan 1993 to Jan 1998

M/s Ashiana Builder

Construction Manager

 

Project: Construction of Multi storied Building at Patna in the State of Bihar; Project Cost: INR 15.05 Crore; Client: Govt. of Bihar;

 

Description of Duties: As Construction Manager (Quality Control) was responsible for Construction of various multi storied buildings in Patna district. Responsible for various tests conducted at site as per MOST specifications in respect of concrete and knowledge of relevant codes, preparation of monthly QC reports. His responsibilities included quality & progress monitoring, reviewing materials; Preparation of Sills and checking of Bills & Claims and entering in measurement books.

 

Jul 1988 to Dec 1992

Subham Engineers Pvt. Ltd.

Site Engineer

Project: Construction for Maintenance and overlay of city roads under Patna Regional Development Authority (Roads) in the State of Bihar; Project Length: 20 Km; Lane-2; Project Cost: INR 10 Crore; Client: PWD, Govt. of Bihar;

 

Project: Construction for Strengthening and widening of roads on NH-30 in the state of Bihar; Client: PWD, Govt. of Bihar;
